New Records: The Padres became the first team in MLB history to clinch a postseason spot with a game-ending triple play.
Key Match Events: Manny Machado started a game-ending triple play to end a 4-2 Padres victory at Dodger Stadium on Tuesday.
Pre-Game Insights: The Padres had bigger goals this year, including winning the National League West title.
Post-Match Reflections: Padres manager Mike Shildt said 'Couldnâ€™t script that any better' after the game-ending triple play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres secured their spot in the postseason after missing out in 2023, and they control their own destiny in the NL West title.
Others: The Padres have reeled off a 41-16 run, the best such stretch in franchise history.
